original: Śaṃkara attrib /🔽Kaṭhopaniṣadbhāṣya
analyzed: śaṃkara attrib
translated: Śaṅkara's commentary🔽Kaṭha Upaniṣad Bhāṣya

original: kāṭhakopaniṣat🔽oṃ saha nāv avatu /
analyzed: kāṭhaka upaniṣad  om saha nau avatu
translated: Kaṭha Upaniṣad🔽Om, may it protect us both.

original: saha nau bhunaktu /
analyzed: saha nau bhunaktu
translated: May it nourish us both.

original: saha vīryaṃ karavāvahai //
analyzed: saha vīryam karavāvahai
translated: May we two work together.

original: tejasvi nāvadhītamastu mā vidviṣāvahai //
analyzed: tejasvi nau adhītam astu mā vidviṣāvahai
translated: May we two be brilliant. May we not hate each other.

original: oṃ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ //
analyzed: om śāntiḥ śāntiḥ śāntiḥ
translated: Om, peace, peace, peace.

original: oṃ namo bhagavate vaivasvatāya mṛtyave brahmavidyācāryāya naciketase ca /
analyzed: om namaḥ bhagavate vaivasvatāya mṛtyave brahma vidyā ācāryāya naciketase ca
translated: Om, salutations to the illustrious Vaivasvata, to Death, to the teacher of the knowledge of Brahman, and to Naciketas.

original: atha kāṭhakopaniṣadvallīnāṃ sukhārthaprabodhanārtham alpagranthā vṛttir ārabhyate /
analyzed: atha kāṭhaka upaniṣad vallīnām sukha artha prabodhana artham alpa granthā vṛttiḥ ārabhyate
translated: Now, a brief commentary is begun for the easy understanding of the meaning of the Valli of the Kaṭha Upaniṣad.

original: sader dhātor viśaraṇagatyavasād anārthasyopanipūrvasya kvippratyayāntasya rūpam idam upaniṣad iti /
analyzed: sadeḥ dhātoḥ viśaraṇa gati avasāt an a arthasya upani pūrvasya kvip pratyaya antasya rūpam idam upaniṣad iti
translated: This is the form of the word Upaniṣad, which is derived from the root sad, meaning to enter, to go, to rest, and the prefix upa, followed by the kvip suffix.

original: upaniṣacchabdena ca vyācikhyāsitagranthapratipādyavedyavastuviṣayā vidyocyate /
analyzed: upaniṣad śabdena ca vyācikhyāsita grantha pratipādya vedya vastu viṣayā vidyā ucyate
translated: And by the word Upaniṣad, the knowledge whose object is the knowable thing taught by the text to be explained is meant.

original: kena punar arthayogenopaniṣacchabdena vidyocyata ity ucyate /
analyzed: kena punar artha yogena upaniṣad śabdena vidyā ucyate iti ucyate
translated: By what meaning is knowledge spoken of by the word Upaniṣad? It is said:

original: ye mumukṣavo dṛṣṭānuśravikaviṣayavitṛṣṇāḥ santa upaniṣacchabdavācyāṃ vakṣyamāṇalakṣaṇāṃ
analyzed: ye mumukṣavaḥ dṛṣṭa ānuśravika viṣaya vitṛṣṇāḥ santaḥ upaniṣad śabda vācyām vakṣyamāṇa lakṣaṇām
translated: Those seekers of liberation who, being free from thirst for seen and heard objects, become

original: vidyām upasadyopagamya tanniṣṭhatayā niścayena śīlayanti teṣām avidyādeḥ saṃsārabijasya
analyzed: vidyām upasadya upagamya tad niṣṭha tayā niścayena śīlayanti teṣām avidyā ādeḥ saṃsāra bijasya
translated: Because of the destruction, the removal, the annihilation of that, of ignorance etc., the seed of worldly existence, by those who, having approached, having gone to, the knowledge, practise it with the firm conviction of being absorbed in it,

original: viśaraṇād dhiṃsanād vināśanād ity anenārthayogena vidyopaniṣad ity ucyate /
analyzed: viśaraṇāt dhiṃsanāt vināśanāt iti anena artha yogena vidyā upaniṣad iti ucyate
translated: it is called the knowledge of Brahman, by the connection of meaning with this.

original: tathā ca vakṣyati nicāyya taṃ mṛtyumukhāt pramucyate KaU / iti /
analyzed: tathā ca vakṣyati nicāyya tam mṛtyu mukhāt pramucyate iti
translated: And so he will say: Having known Him, he is freed from the jaws of death KaU 1.3.

original: pūrvoktaviśeṣaṇān vā mumukṣūn paraṃ brahma gamayatīti brahmagamayitṛtvena yogād brahmavidyopaniṣat /
analyzed: pūrva ukta viśeṣaṇān vā mumukṣūn param brahma gamayati iti brahma gamayitṛ tvena yogāt brahma vidyā upaniṣad
translated: Or, the knowledge of Brahman is called Upanishad because of the connection of the meaning of the root dhā, to place, with the sense of Brahman being the goal, since it leads those who desire liberation and possess the aforementioned qualifications to the supreme Brahman.

original: tathā ca vakṣyati brahmaprāpto virajo 'bhūd vimṛtyuḥ KaU / iti /🔽lokādir brahmajajño yo 'gnis tadviṣayāyā vidyāyā dvitīyena vareṇa prārthyamānāyāḥ🔽svargalokaphalaprāptihetutvena garbhavāsajanmajarādyupadravavṛndasya lokāntare paunaḥpunyena
analyzed: tathā ca vakṣyati brahma prāptaḥ virajaḥ bhūt vimṛtyuḥ kau iti  loka ādiḥ yaḥ gniḥ tad viṣayāyāḥ vidyāyāḥ dvitīyena vareṇa prārthyamānāyāḥ  svarga loka phala prāpti hetu tvena garbha vāsa janma jarā ādi upadrava vṛndasya loka antare paunaḥpunyena
translated: And so he will say: Having attained Brahman, he became free from impurity, free from death KaU 1.3.🔽The knowledge of Agni, which has the Agni born from Brahman as its object, is also called Upanishad because of the connection of the meaning of the root dhā, to place, with the sense of leading to the attainment of the fruit of heaven world, by causing the multitude of calamities such as rebirth, old age etc. to subside, by causing laxity, of that which is repeatedly occurring in other worlds,

original: pravṛttasyāvasādayitṛtvena śaithilyāpādanena dhātvarthayogād agnividyāpy upaniṣad ity ucyate /
analyzed: pravṛttasya avasādayitṛ tvena śaithilya āpādanena dhātvartha yogāt agni vidyā api upaniṣad iti ucyate
translated: which is being requested as a second boon for the knowledge whose object is that Agni born from Brahman.

original: tathā ca vakṣyati svargalokā amṛtatvaṃ bhajante KaU / ity ādi /
analyzed: tathā ca vakṣyati svarga lokāḥ amṛta tvam bhajante kau iti ādi
translated: And so he will say later on: 'They go to the world of heaven and attain immortality' (Ka. Up. 2.3.16), etc.

original: nanu copaniṣacchabdenādhyetāro grantham apy abhilapanti /
analyzed: nanu ca upaniṣad śabdena adhyetāraḥ grantham api abhilapanti
translated: But the students also refer to the text by the word Upanishad.

original: upaniṣadam adhīmaha upaniṣadam adhyāpayāma iti ca /
analyzed: upaniṣadam adhīmahe upaniṣadam adhyāpayāmaḥ iti ca
translated: 'We study the Upanishad', 'We teach the Upanishad' - thus they speak.

original: naiṣa doṣaḥ /
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: avidyādisaṃsārahetuviśaraṇādeḥ sadi dhātvarthasya granthamātre 'sambhavād vidyāyāṃ ca sambhavāt /
analyzed: avidyā ādi saṃsāra hetu viśaraṇa ādeḥ sadi dhātvarthasya grantha mātre sambhavāt vidyāyām ca sambhavāt
translated: Because the meaning of the root 'vid' (to know), such as the removal of ignorance, etc., which are the causes of worldly existence, is not possible in the mere text, but is possible in knowledge.

original: granthasyāpi tādarthyena tacchabdatvopapatter āyur vai dhṛtam ity ādivat /
analyzed: granthasya api tādarthyena tad śabda tva upapatteḥ āyuḥ vai dhṛtam iti ādi vat
translated: And because the text is also called by that word (Upanishad) as being for that purpose (i.e., for the removal of ignorance, etc.), like 'Life is held' (Tait. Up. 1.1.1), etc.

original: tasmād vidyāyāṃ mukhyayā vṛttyopaniṣacchabdo vartate /
analyzed: tasmāt vidyāyām mukhyayā vṛttyā upaniṣad śabdaḥ vartate
translated: Therefore, the word Upanishad is used in its primary sense with regard to knowledge.

original: granthe tu bhaktyeti /
analyzed: granthe tu bhaktyā iti
translated: But with regard to the text, it is used figuratively.

original: evam upaniṣannirvacanenaiva viśiṣṭo 'dhikārī vidyāyām uktaḥ /
analyzed: evam upaniṣad nirvacanena eva viśiṣṭaḥ dhikārī vidyāyām uktaḥ
translated: Thus, by the etymological explanation of Upanishad itself, the qualified person for knowledge is stated.

original: viṣayaś ca viśiṣṭa ukto vidyāyāḥ paraṃ brahma pratyagātmabhūtam /
analyzed: viṣayaḥ ca viśiṣṭaḥ uktaḥ vidyāyāḥ param brahma pratyagātma bhūtam
translated: And the qualified object of knowledge is stated to be the Supreme Brahman, which is the inner Self.

original: prayojanaṃ cāsyā upaniṣada ātyantikī saṃsāranivṛttir brahmaprāptilakṣaṇā /
analyzed: prayojanam ca asyāḥ upaniṣadaḥ ātyantikī saṃsāra nivṛttiḥ brahma prāpti lakṣaṇā
translated: And the purpose of this Upanishad is stated to be the absolute cessation of worldly existence, characterized by the attainment of Brahman.

original: sambandhaś caivaṃ bhūtaprayojanenoktaḥ /
analyzed: sambandhaḥ ca evam bhūta prayojanena uktaḥ
translated: And the relation is stated to be with such a purpose.

original: ato yathoktādhikāriviṣayaprayojanasambandhāyā vidyāyāḥ karatalanyastāmalakavat prakāśakatvena viśiṣṭādhikāriviṣayaprayojanasambandhā etā vallyo 🔽bhavantīti /
analyzed: atas yathā ukta adhikāri viṣaya prayojana sambandhāyāḥ vidyāyāḥ kara tala nyasta āmalaka vat prakāśaka tvena viśiṣṭa adhikāri viṣaya prayojana sambandhāḥ etāḥ vallyaḥ  bhavanti iti
translated: Therefore, these creepers are distinguished by their connection with the qualified person, object, and purpose, as illuminators of the knowledge which has the mentioned authority, object, and purpose, like an amalaka fruit placed in the palm of the hand.

original: atas tā yathāpratibhānaṃ vyācakṣmahe / oṃ
analyzed: atas tāḥ yathāpratibhānam vyācakṣmahe om
translated: Thus, we shall explain them according to our understanding. Om

original: uśan ha vai vājaśravasaḥ sarvavedasaṃ dadau /
analyzed: uśan ha vai vājaśravasaḥ sarvavedasam dadau
translated: Ushanas, desiring, indeed, gave away all his possessions.

original: tasya ha naciketā nāma putra āsa // // / / //
analyzed: tasya ha naciketāḥ nāma putraḥ āsa
translated: To him, indeed, there was a son named Nachiketa.

original: tatrākhyāyikā vidyāstutyarthā /
analyzed: tatra ākhyāyikā vidyā stuti arthā
translated: There, the story is for the purpose of praising the knowledge.

original: uśan kāmayamāno ha vā iti vṛttārthasmaraṇārthau nipātau /
analyzed: uśan kāmayamānaḥ ha vā iti vṛtta artha smaraṇa arthau nipātau
translated: The words Ushanas and ha are indeclinable particles denoting the sense of indeed and desiring.

original: vājamannaṃ taddānādinimittaṃ śravo yaśo yasya sa vājaśravā /
analyzed: vājam annam tad dāna ādi nimittam śravaḥ yaśaḥ yasya sa vājaśravāḥ
translated: Vaja means food, and shrava means fame, for whom that is the cause of giving etc., he is Vashishtha.

original: rūḍhito vā /🔽tasyāpatyaṃ vājaśravasaḥ /
analyzed: rūḍhitaḥ vā  tasya apatyam vājaśravasaḥ
translated: Or, it is a conventional term.🔽He is the son of Vashishtha.

original: sa kila viśvajitā sarvamedheneje tatphalaṃ kāmayamānaḥ /
analyzed: sa kila viśvajitā sarvamedhena īje tad phalam kāmayamānaḥ
translated: He, desiring the fruit of that, indeed performed the Vishvajit, the all-conquering sacrifice.

original: tasmin kratau sarvavedasaṃ sarvasvaṃ dhanaṃ dadau dattavān /
analyzed: tasmin kratau sarvavedasam sarva svam dhanam dadau dattavān
translated: In that sacrifice, he gave away all his possessions, all his wealth, as a gift.

original: tasya yajamānasya ha naciketā nāma putraḥ kilāsa babhūva // // / / //
analyzed: tasya yajamānasya ha naciketāḥ nāma putraḥ kilāsa babhūva
translated: To that sacrificer, indeed, there was a son named Nachiketa.

original: taṃ ha kumāraṃ santaṃ dakṣiṇāsu nīyamānāsu śraddhāviveśa so 'manyata // // / / //
analyzed: tam ha kumāram santam dakṣiṇāsu nīyamānāsu śraddhā āviveśa saḥ manyata
translated: Now, when that boy was about to be taken to the sacrificial ground, faith entered him. He thought:

original: taṃ ha naciketasaṃ kumāraṃ prathamavayasaṃ santam aprāptajananaśaktiṃ bālam eva śraddhāstikyabuddhiḥ pitur hitakāmaprayuktaviveśa praviṣṭavatī
analyzed: tam ha naciketasam kumāram prathama vayasam santam aprāpta janana śaktim bālam eva śraddhā āstikya buddhiḥ pituḥ hita kāma prayuktā viveśa praviṣṭavatī
translated: That boy Naciketas, being in the first stage of life, not having attained the capacity for procreation, being a mere child, faith, the belief in the existence of God, entered him.

original: kasmin kāla ity āha ṛtvigbhyaḥ sadasyebhyaś ca dakṣiṇāsu nīyamānāsu vibhāgenopanīyamānāsu dakṣiṇārthāsu goṣu /
analyzed: kasmin kāle iti āha ṛtvigbhyaḥ sadasyebhyaḥ ca dakṣiṇāsu nīyamānāsu vibhāgena upanīyamānāsu dakṣiṇā arthāsu goṣu
translated: In what time? He says: when the sacrificial fees were being taken away to the priests and the members of the sacrificial assembly, when the cows intended as sacrificial fees were being distributed.

original: sa āviṣṭaśraddho naciketā amanyata // // / / //
analyzed: saḥ āviṣṭa śraddhaḥ naciketāḥ amanyata
translated: That Naciketas, whose faith had entered him, thought:

original: pītodakā jagdhatṛṇā dugdhadohā nirindriyāḥ /
analyzed: pīta udakāḥ jagdha tṛṇāḥ dugdha dohāḥ nirindriyāḥ
translated: Those who give cows whose water has been drunk, whose grass has been eaten, whose milk has been milked, who are devoid of senses,

original: anandā nāma te lokāstānsa gacchati tā dadat // // / / //
analyzed: anandāḥ nāma te lokāḥ tān sa gacchati tāḥ dadat
translated: those worlds are called 'without joy'; he who gives them goes to those.

original: katham ity ucyate pītodakā ity ādinā dakṣiṇārthā gāvo viśeṣyante /🔽pītam udakaṃ yābhis tāḥ pītodakāḥ /🔽jagdhaṃ bhakṣitaṃ tṛṇaṃ yābhis tā jagdhatṛṇāḥ /
analyzed: katham iti ucyate pīta udakāḥ iti ādinā dakṣiṇā arthāḥ gāvaḥ viśeṣyante  pītam udakam yābhiḥ tāḥ pīta udakāḥ  jagdham bhakṣitam tṛṇam yābhiḥ tāḥ jagdhatṛṇāḥ
translated: How? It is said by whose water has been drunk and so on. The cows intended as sacrificial fees are specified.🔽Those whose water has been drunk are whose water has been drunk.🔽Those whose grass has been eaten are whose grass has been eaten.

original: dugdho dohaḥ kṣīrākhyo yāsāṃ tā dugdhadohāḥ /
analyzed: dugdhaḥ dohaḥ kṣīra ākhyaḥ yāsām tāḥ dugdhadohāḥ
translated: Those whose milk has been milked, whose milk is called dugdha, are whose milk has been milked.

original: nirindriyā prajananāsamarthā jīrṇā niṣphalā gāva ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: nirindriyā prajanana asamarthāḥ jīrṇāḥ niṣphalāḥ gāvaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they are like old cows, devoid of senses, incapable of reproduction, worn out, and fruitless.

original: yās tā evambhūtā gā ṛtvigbhyo dakṣiṇābuddhyā dadatprayacchannanandā anānandā asukhā nāmety etad ye te lokās tān sa yajamāno gacchati // // / /
analyzed: yāḥ tāḥ evambhūtāḥ gāḥ ṛtvigbhyaḥ dakṣiṇā buddhyā dadat prayacchan anandāḥ anānandāḥ asukhāḥ nāma iti etat ye te lokāḥ tān sa yajamānaḥ gacchati  /
translated: Giving those cows, which are in such a state, to the priests with the idea of them being sacrificial fees, he gave, he offered them. He had no joy, he was unhappy. The meaning is that he became known as such. He, the sacrificer, went to those worlds which are like that.

original: sa hovāca pitaraṃ tata kasmai māṃ dāsyasīti /
analyzed: sa ha uvāca pitaram tata kasmai mām dāsyasi iti
translated: He said to his father: To whom will you give me then?

original: dvitīyaṃ tṛtīyaṃ taṃ hovāca mṛtyave tvā dadāmīti // // / / //
analyzed: dvitīyam tṛtīyam tam ha uvāca mṛtyave tvā dadāmi iti
translated: The second time, the third time. He said to him: I will give you to Death.

original: tad evaṃ kratvasampattinimittaṃ pitur aniṣṭaṃ phalaṃ mayā putreṇa satā nivāraṇīyam
analyzed: tat evam kratu asampatti nimittam pituḥ aniṣṭam phalam mayā putreṇa satā nivāraṇīyam
translated: Thus, thinking that I, as a son, should prevent my father's undesirable result which is caused by the incompleteness of the sacrifice,

original: ātmapradānenāpi kratusampattiṃ kṛtvā ity evaṃ matvā pitaram upagamya sa hovāca pitaram
analyzed: ātma pradānena api kratu sampattim kṛtvā iti evam matvā pitaram upagamya sa ha uvāca pitaram
translated: even by giving myself, and thus make the sacrifice complete, thinking thus, he approached his father and said to him:

original: he tata tāta kasmā ṛtvigviśeṣāya dakṣiṇārthaṃ māṃ dāsyasīti prayacchasīty etat /
analyzed: he tata tāta kasmai ṛtvij viśeṣāya dakṣiṇā artham mām dāsyasi iti prayacchasi iti etat
translated: O father, to whom will you give me, for the sake of sacrificial fees, to a particular priest? You are giving, this is the meaning.

original: evam uktena pitropekṣyamāṇo 'pi dvitīyaṃ tṛtiyam apy uvāca kasmai māṃ dāsyasi kasmai māṃ dāsyasīti /
analyzed: evam uktena pitrā upekṣyamāṇaḥ dvitīyam tṛtiyam api uvāca kasmai mām dāsyasi kasmai mām dāsyasi iti
translated: Even though ignored by the father when spoken to thus, he said for the second time, the third time: To whom will you give me? To whom will you give me?

original: nāyaṃ kumārasvabhāva iti kruddhaḥ san pitā taṃ ha putraṃ kilovāca mṛtyave vaivasvatāya tvā tvāṃ dadāmīti // // / / //
analyzed: na ayam kumāra svabhāvaḥ iti kruddhaḥ san pitā tam ha putram kila uvāca mṛtyave vaivasvatāya tvā tvām dadāmi iti
translated: This is not the nature of a son,' being angry, the father is said to have spoken thus to his son: 'I give you over to Death, to Vaivasvata.'

original: bahūnām emi prathamo bahūnām emi madhyamaḥ /
analyzed: bahūnām emi prathamaḥ bahūnām emi madhyamaḥ
translated: I go as the foremost of many, I go as the middlemost of many.

original: kiṃ svid yamasya kartavyaṃ yan mayādya kariṣyati // // / / //
analyzed: kim svid yamasya kartavyam yat mayā adya kariṣyati
translated: What, indeed, is the duty of Yama that he will perform today by me?

original: sa evam uktaḥ putra ekānte paridevayāñ cakāra /
analyzed: saḥ evam uktaḥ putraḥ ekānte paridevayām cakāra
translated: Thus addressed, the son lamented in a secluded place.

original: katham ity ucyate bahūnāṃ śiṣyāṇāṃ putrāṇāṃ vā emi gacchāmi prathamaḥ sanmukhyayā śiṣyādivṛttyety arthaḥ /
analyzed: katham iti ucyate bahūnām śiṣyāṇām putrāṇām vā emi gacchāmi prathamaḥ sat mukhyayā śiṣya ādi vṛttyā iti arthaḥ
translated: How is it said? I go as the foremost of many disciples or sons, meaning I go as the chief by the primary conduct of a disciple and so on.

original: madhyamānāṃ ca bahūnāṃ madhyamo madhyamayaiva vṛttyaimi /
analyzed: madhyamānām ca bahūnām madhyamaḥ madhyamayā eva vṛttyā emi
translated: And I go as the middlemost of many middling ones by the conduct of the middlemost.

original: nādhamayā kadācid api /
analyzed: na adhamayā kadācid api
translated: Never by the lowest conduct.

original: tam evaṃ viśiṣṭaguṇam api putraṃ māṃ mṛtyave tvā dadāmi KaU /
analyzed: tam evam viśiṣṭa guṇam api putram mām mṛtyave tvā dadāmi kau
translated: To that son of such distinguished qualities, I give you over to Death, O son.

original: ity uktavān pitā /
analyzed: iti uktavān pitā
translated: Thus spoke the father.

original: sa kiṃ svid yamasya kartavyaṃ prayojanaṃ mayā prattena kariṣyati yatkartavyam adya /
analyzed: sa kim svid yamasya kartavyam prayojanam mayā prattena kariṣyati yat kartavyam adya
translated: What, indeed, is the purpose of Yama that he will perform today by me who is given over? What is to be done?

original: nūnaṃ prayojanam anapekṣyaiva krodhavaśād uktavān pitā /
analyzed: nūnam prayojanam an apekṣya eva krodha vaśāt uktavān pitā
translated: Surely, the father spoke out of anger alone, without regard to purpose.

original: tathāpi tatpitur vaco mṛṣā mā bhūditi // // / / //
analyzed: tathā api tad pituḥ vacaḥ mṛṣā mā bhūt iti
translated: Still, lest his father's words be false,

original: evaṃ matvā paridevanāpūrvakam āha pitaraṃ śokāviṣṭa kiṃ vā mayoktam iti
analyzed: evam matvā paridevanā pūrvakam āha pitaram śoka āviṣṭa kim vā mayā uktam iti
translated: Thinking thus, he said to his father, overwhelmed with grief, What should I say?

original: anupaśya yathā pūrve pratipaśya tathāpare /
analyzed: anupaśya yathā pūrve pratipaśya tathā apare
translated: Behold how the former lived, and thus look to the future.

original: sasyam iva martyaḥ pacyate sasyam ivājāyate punaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: sasyam iva martyaḥ pacyate sasyam iva ājāyate punar
translated: Like a plant a mortal man is born again and again.

original: anupaśyālocaya vibhāvayānukrameṇa yathā yena prakāreṇa vṛtāḥ pūrve 'tikrāntāḥ pitṛpitāmahādayas tava /🔽tān dṛṣṭrvā ca teṣāṃ vṛttam āsthātum arhasi /
analyzed: anupaśya ālocaya vibhāvaya anukrameṇa yathā yena prakāreṇa vṛtāḥ pūrve tikrāntāḥ pitṛ pitāmaha ādayaḥ tava  tān dṛṣṭrvā ca teṣām vṛttam āsthātum arhasi
translated: Behold, look, understand in order, how the former, the deceased, your father's father and so on, lived.🔽Having seen them, you should follow their conduct.

original: vartamānāś cāpare sādhavo yathā vartante tāṃś ca tathā pratipaśyālocaya /
analyzed: vartamānāḥ ca apare sādhavaḥ yathā vartante tān ca tathā pratipaśya ālocaya
translated: And the present good people, look to them in the same way as they live.

original: na ca teṣāṃ mṛṣākaraṇaṃ vṛttaṃ vartamānaṃ vāsti /
analyzed: na ca teṣām mṛṣākaraṇam vṛttam vartamānam vā asti
translated: And their conduct, past and present, is not false.

original: tadviparītam asatāṃ ca vṛttaṃ mṛṣākaraṇam /
analyzed: tad viparītam asatām ca vṛttam mṛṣākaraṇam
translated: The conduct of the wicked is the opposite, and false.

original: na ca mṛṣābhūtaṃ kṛtvā kaścid ajarāmaro bhavati /
analyzed: na ca mṛṣābhūtam kṛtvā kaścid ajara amaraḥ bhavati
translated: And no one becomes immortal by doing what is false.

original: yataḥ sasyam iva martyo manuṣyaḥ pacyate jīrṇo mriyate /
analyzed: yatas sasyam iva martyaḥ manuṣyaḥ pacyate jīrṇaḥ mriyate
translated: For like a plant a mortal man, a human being, is born again and again, and when old, dies.

original: mṛtvā ca sasyam ivājāyata āvirbhavati punar evam anitye jīvaloke kiṃ mṛṣākaraṇena /
analyzed: mṛtvā ca sasyam iva ājāyate āvirbhavati punar evam anitye jīva loke kim mṛṣākaraṇena
translated: And after death, he is born again, like a crop. Thus, in this transient world of living beings, what is the use of false actions?

original: pālayātmanaḥ satyam /
analyzed: pālaya ātmanaḥ satyam
translated: And after death, he is born again, like a crop of corn. Thus, in this transient world of living beings, what is the use of doing false things?🔽Protect your own truth.

original: preṣaya māṃ yamāyety abhiprāyaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: preṣaya mām yamāya iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The meaning is: Send me to Yama.

original: vaiśvānaraḥ praviśati atithir brāhmaṇo gṛhān /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ praviśati atithiḥ brāhmaṇaḥ gṛhān
translated: The guest, a Brahmin, enters the house like the all-consuming fire.

original: tasyaitāṃ śāntiṃ kurvanti hara vaivasvatodakam // // / / //
analyzed: tasya etām śāntim kurvanti hara vaivasvata udakam
translated: For him, they perform this pacification: O Harivāivasvata, bring water.

original: sa evam uktaḥ pitātmanaḥ satyatāyai preṣayāmāsa /
analyzed: saḥ evam uktaḥ pitā ātmanaḥ satyatāyai preṣayāmāsa
translated: Thus addressed, the father sent him for the sake of his own truth.

original: sa ca yamabhavanaṃ gatvā tistro rātrīr uvāsa yame proṣite /
analyzed: sa ca yama bhavanam gatvā tistraḥ rātrīḥ uvāsa yame proṣite
translated: And he, having gone to Yama's abode, stayed for three nights while Yama was away.

original: proṣyāgataṃ yamam amātyā bhāryā vā ūcur bodhayanto vaiśvānaro 'gnir eva sākṣāt praviśaty atithiḥ san brāhmaṇo gṛhān dahann iva /
analyzed: proṣya āgatam yamam amātyāḥ bhāryāḥ vai ūcuḥ bodhayantaḥ vaiśvānaraḥ gniḥ eva sākṣāt praviśati atithiḥ san brāhmaṇaḥ gṛhān dahan iva
translated: When Yama returned, his ministers or wife said to him, awakening him: The guest, a Brahmin, enters the house like the all-consuming fire, as if burning it.

original: tasya dāhaṃ śamayanta ivāgner etāṃ pādyāsanādidānalakṣaṇāṃ śāntiṃ kurvanti santo 'tither yataḥ /
analyzed: tasya dāham śamayantaḥ iva agneḥ etām pādya āsana ādi dāna lakṣaṇām śāntim kurvanti titheḥ yatas
translated: The virtuous perform this pacification, characterized by offering water to wash the feet, a seat, etc., as if pacifying the burning of the fire, for the guest.

original: ato harāhara he vaivasvatodakaṃ naciketase pādyārtham /
analyzed: atas hara āhara he vaivasvata udakam naciketase pādya artham
translated: Therefore, O Harivāivasvata, bring water for Nāciketa's feet.

original: yataś cākaraṇepratyavāyaḥ śrūyate // // / / //
analyzed: yatas ca a karaṇe pratyavāyaḥ śrūyate
translated: And it is heard that there is a consequence for not doing it.

original: āśāpratīkṣe saṃgataṃ sūnṛtāṃ ca iṣṭāpūrte putrapaśūṃś ca sarvān /
analyzed: āśā pratīkṣe saṃgatam sūnṛtām ca iṣṭāpūrte putra paśūn ca sarvān
translated: Hope and expectation, association with the good, and truthfulness, sacrifices, good works, and all the sons and cattle,

original: etad vṛṅkte puruṣasyālpamedhaso yasyānaśnan vasati brāhmaṇo gṛhe // // / / //🔽āśāpratīkṣa anirjñātaprāpyeṣṭārthaprārthanā āśā /
analyzed: etat vṛṅkte puruṣasya alpamedhasaḥ yasya an aśnan vasati brāhmaṇaḥ gṛhe  āśā pratīkṣa a nirjñāta prāpya iṣṭa artha prārthanā āśā
translated: all this is lost to a man of little intelligence, if a Brahmana lives in his house without being fed.🔽Hope is the desire for an unknown and attainable object.

original: nirjñātaprāpyārthapratīkṣaṇaṃ pratīkṣā /
analyzed: nirjñāta prāpya artha pratīkṣaṇam pratīkṣā
translated: Expectation is the waiting for a known and attainable object.

original: ta āśāpratīkṣe /
analyzed: te āśā pratīkṣe
translated: These are hope and expectation.

original: saṅgataṃ satsaṃyogajaṃ phalam /
analyzed: saṅga tam sat saṃyoga jam phalam
translated: Association is the fruit born from association with the good.

original: sūnṛtāṃ ca sūnṛtā hi priyā vāktannimittajaṃ ca /
analyzed: sūnṛtām ca sūnṛtā hi priyā vāc tad nimitta jam ca
translated: And truthfulness, for truthfulness is pleasant speech and the fruit born from that.

original: iṣṭāpūrte iṣṭaṃ yāgajaṃ phalam /
analyzed: iṣṭāpūrte iṣṭam yāga jam phalam
translated: Sacrifices is the fruit born from sacrifices.

original: pūrtam ārāmādi kriyājaṃ phalam /
analyzed: pūrtam ārāma ādi kriyā jam phalam
translated: Good works is the fruit born from actions like building temples.

original: putrapaśūṃś ca putrāṃś ca sarvān etat sarvaṃ yathoktaṃ vṛṅkte varjayati vināśayatīty etat /
analyzed: putra paśūn ca putrān ca sarvān etat sarvam yathoktam vṛṅkte varjayati vināśayati iti etat
translated: And all the sons and cattle, all this as described, is lost, abandoned, destroyed.

original: puruṣasyālpamedhaso 'lpaprajñasya /
analyzed: puruṣasya alpa medhasaḥ lpa prajñasya
translated: Of a man of little intelligence, of little wisdom.

original: yasyānaśnannabhuñjāno brāhmaṇo gṛhe vasati /
analyzed: yasya an aśnan a bhuñjānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ gṛhe vasati
translated: If a Brahmana lives in his house without being fed.

original: tasmād anupekṣaṇīyaḥ sarvāvasthāsv apy atithir ity arthaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt anupekṣaṇīyaḥ sarva avasthāsu api atithiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, a guest should not be neglected in any condition. This is the meaning.

original: tisro rātrīr yad avatsīr gṛhe me anaśnan brahmann atithir namasyaḥ /
analyzed: tisraḥ rātrīḥ yat gṛhe me an aśnan brahman atithiḥ namasyaḥ
translated: For three nights you have stayed in my house, O Brahmana guest, not eating.

original: namas te 'stu brahman svasti me 'stu tasmāt prati trīn varān vṛṇīṣva // // / / //
analyzed: namaḥ te stu brahman svasti me stu tasmāt prati trīn varān vṛṇīṣva
translated: Be homage to you, O Brahman! Let all be well with me. Therefore, choose three boons from me.

original: evam ukto mṛtyur uvāca naciketasam upagamya pūjāpuraḥsaram /🔽tistro rātrīr yad yasmād avātsīr uṣitavānasi gṛhe me mamānaśnan he brahmann atithiḥ san namasyo namaskārārhaś ca /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ mṛtyuḥ uvāca naciketasam upagamya pūjā puraḥsaram  tistraḥ rātrīḥ yat yasmāt avātsīḥ uṣitavān asi gṛhe me mama an aśnan he brahman atithiḥ san namasyaḥ namaskāra arhaḥ ca
translated: Thus addressed, Death approached Nachiketa and, preceded by worship, said:

original: tasmān namaste tubhyam astu bhavatu /
analyzed: tasmāt namaḥ te tubhyam astu bhavatu
translated: O Brahman, since you have stayed in my house for three nights, not eating, as a guest deserving honor, therefore let there be homage to you.

original: he brahman svasti bhadraṃ me 'stu /
analyzed: he brahman svasti bhadram me stu
translated: Let all be well with me, O Brahman.

original: tasmād bhavato 'naśanena madgṛhavāsanimittād doṣāt /
analyzed: tasmāt bhavataḥ naśanena mad gṛha vāsa nimittāt doṣāt
translated: Therefore, by your not eating due to the fault of staying in my house,

original: tatprāptyupaśamena yady api bhavad anugraheṇa sarvaṃ mama svasti syāt tathāpi tvadadhikasamprasādanārtham
analyzed: tad prāpti upaśamena yadi api bhavat anugraheṇa sarvam mama svasti syāt tathā api tvad adhika samprasādana artham
translated: although everything may be well with me through your favor by the cessation of attaining that, still🔽for each night spent without eating, choose three boons, the specific desired objects, from me.

original: anaśanenoṣitām ekaikāṃ rātriṃ prati trīn varān vṛṇīṣv ābhipretārthaviśeṣān prārthayasva🔽mattaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: anaśanena uṣitām ekaikām rātrim prati trīn varān vṛṇīṣu ā abhipreta artha viśeṣān prārthayasva  mattaḥ
translated: From me.

original: śāntasaṅkalpaḥ sumanā yathā syād vītamanyur gautamo mābhi mṛtyo /
analyzed: śānta saṅkalpaḥ su manāḥ yathā syāt vīta manyuḥ gautamaḥ mā abhi mṛtyo
translated: O Death, may Gautama be peaceful in resolve, well-disposed in mind, and free from anger towards me.

original: tvatprasṛṣṭaṃ mābhivadet pratīta etat trayāṇāṃ prathamaṃ varaṃ vṛṇe // // / / //
analyzed: tvad prasṛṣṭam mā abhivadet pratītaḥ etat trayāṇām prathamam varam vṛṇe
translated: Let him, when sent back by you, recognize me. This is the first of the three boons I choose.

original: naciketās tv āha yadi ditsur varān śāntasaṅkalpa upaśāntaḥ saṅkalpo yasya māṃ prati /
analyzed: naciketāḥ tu āha yadi ditsuḥ varān śānta saṅkalpaḥ upaśāntaḥ saṅkalpaḥ yasya mām prati
translated: But Naciketas said: If you are willing to give boons, with peaceful resolve, with your resolve for peace, for me,

original: yamaṃ prāpya kin nu kariṣyati mama putra iti /
analyzed: yamam prāpya kim nu kariṣyati mama putraḥ iti
translated: having reached Yama, what will my son do?

original: sa śāntasaṅkalpaḥ sumanāḥ prasannamanāś ca yathā syād vītamanyur vigataroṣaś ca gautamo mama pitā mābhi māṃ prati he mṛtyo /
analyzed: sa śānta saṅkalpaḥ su manāḥ prasanna manāḥ ca yathā syāt vīta manyuḥ vigata roṣaḥ ca gautamaḥ mama pitā mā abhi mām prati he mṛtyo
translated: You be peaceful in resolve, well-disposed, with a cheerful mind, free from anger, just as my father Gautama was. Do not, O Death, be angry with me.

original: kiñ ca tvatprasṛṣṭaṃ tvayā vinirmuktaṃ preṣitaṃ gṛhaṃ prati mām abhivadet pratīto labdhasmṛtiḥ /
analyzed: kim ca tvad prasṛṣṭam tvayā vinirmuktam preṣitam gṛham prati mām abhivadet pratītaḥ labdha smṛtiḥ
translated: And what is sent forth by you, what is released, dispatched back to the house, let him recognize me, with regained memory.

original: sa evāyaṃ putro mamāgata ity evaṃ pratyabhijānann ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva ayam putraḥ mama āgataḥ iti evam pratyabhijānan iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: recognizing me thus, thinking This is my son who has come back.

original: etat prayojanaṃ trayāṇāṃ varāṇāṃ prathamam ādyaṃ varaṃ vṛṇe prārthaye yatpituḥ paritoṣaṇam // // / / //
analyzed: etat prayojanam trayāṇām varāṇām prathamam ādyam varam vṛṇe prārthaye yat pituḥ paritoṣaṇam
translated: This is the purpose, the first, the foremost boon of the three that I choose, that I seek, which is the satisfaction of my father.

original: yathā purastād bhavitā pratīta auddālakir āruṇir matprasṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yathā purastāt bhavitā pratīta auddālakiḥ āruṇiḥ mad prasṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Just as in the past, Uddalaka, the son of Aruni, was recognized by me, sent forth by me,

original: sukhaṃ rātrīḥ śayitā vītamanyus tvāṃ dadṛśivān mṛtyumukhāt pramuktam // // / / //
analyzed: sukham rātrīḥ śayitā vīta manyuḥ tvām dadṛśivān mṛtyu mukhāt pramuktam
translated: You have seen your son freed from the jaws of death, and have slept happily through the nights, free from anger.

original: mṛtyur uvāca yathā buddhis tvayi purastāt pūrvam āsīt snehasamanvitā pitus tava🔽bhavitā prītisamanvitas tava pitā tathaiva pratītaḥ pratītavān sann auddālakir uddālaka evauddālakiḥ /🔽aruṇasyāpatyam āruṇir dvyāmuṣyāyaṇo vā matprasṛṣṭo mayānujñātaḥ sann uttarā api rātrīḥ
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ uvāca yathā buddhiḥ tvayi purastāt pūrvam āsīt sneha samanvitā pituḥ tava  bhavitā prīti samanvitaḥ tava pitā tathā eva pratītaḥ pratītavān san auddālakiḥ uddālakaḥ eva auddālakiḥ  aruṇasya apatyam āruṇiḥ dvyāmuṣyāyaṇaḥ vā mad prasṛṣṭaḥ mayā anujñātaḥ san uttarāḥ api rātrīḥ
translated: Death said: Just as your father had affection for you in the past,

original: sukhaṃ prasannamanāḥ śayitā svaptā vītamanyur vigatamanyuś ca bhavati syāt tvāṃ putraṃ
analyzed: sukham prasanna manāḥ śayitā svaptā vīta manyuḥ vigata manyuḥ ca bhavati syāt tvām putram
translated: so will your father be filled with joy, delighted, and satisfied. Uddālaka is the son of Āruṇi, or the son of Dvyāmuṣyāyaṇa, who has been released by me, with my permission, and who, having been released by me, will sleep happily and dream peacefully through the remaining nights, free from anger, free from enmity, having seen you, his son,

original: dadṛśivān dṛṣṭavān san mṛtyumukhān mṛtyugocarāt pramuktaṃ santam // // / / //
analyzed: dadṛśivān dṛṣṭavān san mṛtyu mukhāt mṛtyu gocarāt pramuktam santam
translated: freed from the jaws of death, from the domain of death.

original: svarge loke na bhayaṃ kiṃcanāsti na tatra tvaṃ na jarayā bibheti /
analyzed: svarge loke na bhayam kiṃcana asti na tatra tvam na jarayā bibheti
translated: In the heavenly world there is no fear at all. You will not go there, nor do you fear old age.

original: ubhe tīrtvā aśanāyāpipāse śokātigo modate svargaloke // // / / //
analyzed: ubhe tīrtvā aśanāyā pipāse śoka atigaḥ modate svarga loke
translated: Having crossed over both hunger and thirst, free from sorrow, he delights in the heavenly world.

original: naciketā uvāca svarge loke rogādinimittaṃ bhayaṃ kiñcana kiñcid api nāsti /
analyzed: naciketāḥ uvāca svarge loke roga ādi nimittam bhayam kiñcana kiñcid api na asti
translated: Naciketas said: In the heavenly world, there is no fear of any kind, even the slightest, caused by disease, etc.

original: na ca tatra tvaṃ mṛtyo sahasā prabhavasi /
analyzed: na ca tatra tvam mṛtyo sahasā prabhavasi
translated: And there, O Death, you do not suddenly prevail.

original: ato jarayā yukta iha lokavat tvatto na bibheti kaścit tatra /
analyzed: atas jarayā yuktaḥ iha loka vat tvattaḥ na bibheti kaścid tatra
translated: Therefore, no one there fears you, as one does old age here in this world.

original: kiñcobha aśanāyāpipāse tīrtvātikramya śokam atītya gacchatīti śokātigaḥ san mānasena duḥkhena varjito modate hṛṣyati svargaloke divye // // / /
analyzed: kiñca ubha aśanāyā pipāse tīrtvā atikramya śokam atītya gacchati iti śoka atigaḥ san mānasena duḥkhena varjitaḥ modate hṛṣyati svarga loke divye  /
translated: Moreover, having crossed over hunger and thirst, having transcended grief, one goes on, being one who has gone beyond grief, being free from mental sorrow, he rejoices, he delights in the heavenly world, which is free from all grief.

original: sa tvam agniṃ svargyam adhyeṣi mṛtyo prabrūhi taṃ śraddadhānāya mahyam /
analyzed: sa tvam agnim svargyam adhyeṣi mṛtyo prabrūhi tam śraddadhānāya mahyam
translated: You, O Death, remember, you know, the heavenly fire. Tell it to me, who have faith.

original: svargalokā amṛtatvaṃ bhajanta etad dvitīyena vṛṇe vareṇa // // / / //
analyzed: svarga lokāḥ amṛta tvam bhajante etat dvitīyena vṛṇe vareṇa
translated: By this, they attain the heavenly world and immortality. This I choose with the second boon.

original: evaṅ guṇaviśiṣṭasya svargalokasya prāptisādhanabhūtaṃ svargyam agniṃ sa tvaṃ mṛtyur adhyeṣi smarasi jānāsīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: evaṅ guṇa viśiṣṭasya svarga lokasya prāpti sādhana bhūtam svargyam agnim sa tvam mṛtyuḥ adhyeṣi smarasi jānāsi iti arthaḥ
translated: You, O Death, remember, you know, the heavenly fire, which is the means of attaining the heavenly world endowed with such qualities.

original: he mṛtyo yatas taṃ prabrūhi kathaya śraddadhānāya śraddhāvate mahyaṃ svargārthine /
analyzed: he mṛtyo yatas tam prabrūhi kathaya śraddadhānāya śraddhāvate mahyam svarga arthine
translated: O Death, tell it to me, who have faith, who have devotion, who seek heaven.

original: yenāgninā citena svargalokaḥ svargo loko yeṣāṃ te svargalokā yajamānā amṛtatvam amaraṇatāṃ
analyzed: yena agninā citena svarga lokaḥ svargaḥ lokaḥ yeṣām te svarga lokāḥ yajamānāḥ amṛta tvam amaraṇa tām
translated: By that fire which is piled up, the heaven-world, the heaven is the world of those who have it, the sacrificers attain immortality, deathlessness,

original: devatvaṃ bhajante prāpnuvanti tad etad agnivijñānaṃ dvitīyena vareṇa vṛṇe // // / / //
analyzed: deva tvam bhajante prāpnuvanti tat etat agni vijñānam dvitīyena vareṇa vṛṇe
translated: the state of gods, I choose this knowledge of fire with the second boon.

original: pra te bravīmi tad u me nibodha svargyam agniṃ naciketaḥ prajānan /
analyzed: pra te bravīmi tat u me nibodha svargyam agnim naciketaḥ prajānan
translated: I tell you that, understand it from me, O Naciketas, knowing the fire which leads to heaven.

original: anantalokāptim atho pratiṣṭhāṃ viddhi tvam etaṃ nihitaṃ guhāyām // // / / //
analyzed: ananta loka āptim atha u pratiṣṭhām viddhi tvam etam nihitam guhāyām
translated: Know this to be the attainment of endless worlds and the foundation, hidden in the cave.

original: mṛtyoḥ pratijñā iyam pra te tubhyaṃ prabravīmi /
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ pratijñā iyam pra te tubhyam prabravīmi
translated: This is the vow of Death. I tell it to you.

original: yat tvayā prārthitaṃ tadu me mama vacaso nibodha budhyasvaikāgramanāḥ san svargyaṃ svargāya hitaṃ svargasādhanam agniṃ he naciketaḥ prajānan
analyzed: yat tvayā prārthitam tat u me mama vacasaḥ nibodha budhyasva ekāgra manāḥ san svargyam svargāya hitam svarga sādhanam agnim he naciketaḥ prajānan
translated: What you have asked for, understand that from my words, being one-pointed in mind. The fire which leads to heaven, which is beneficial for heaven, the means of attaining heaven, O Naciketas, knowing

original: vijñātavān sann aham ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: vijñātavān san aham iti arthaḥ
translated: that I am telling you. The meaning is that you know it.

original: prabravīmi tan nibodheti ca śiṣyabuddhisamādhānārthaṃ vacanam /
analyzed: prabravīmi tat nibodha iti ca śiṣya buddhi samādhāna artham vacanam
translated: And the statement I tell you, understand it is for the purpose of concentrating the disciple's mind.

original: adhunāgniṃ stauti anantaṃ lokāpti svargalokaphalaprāptisādhanam ity etat /
analyzed: adhunā agnim stauti anantam loka āpti svarga loka phala prāpti sādhanam iti etat
translated: Now he praises fire, saying it is the means of attaining endless worlds, the attainment of the heavenly world, the attainment of the fruit of heaven.

original: atho 'pi pratiṣṭhām āśrayaṃ jagato virāḍrūpeṇa tam etam agniṃ mayocyamānaṃ viddhi vijānīhi tvaṃ nihitaṃ sthitaṃ guhāyāṃ viduṣāṃ buddhau niviṣṭam
analyzed: atha u pi pratiṣṭhām āśrayam jagataḥ virāj rūpeṇa tam etam agnim mayā ucyamānam viddhi vijānīhi tvam nihitam sthitam guhāyām viduṣām buddhau niviṣṭam  /
translated: Moreover, know that this Agni, who is spoken of as Maya, is the support, the abode of the world in the form of Virat, is placed, is situated in the cave, in the intellect of the wise.

original: ity arthaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: lokādim agniṃ tam uvāca tasmai yā iṣṭakā yāvatīr vā yathā vā /
analyzed: loka ādim agnim tam uvāca tasmai yāḥ iṣṭakāḥ yāvatīḥ vā yathā vā
translated: Death spoke to him about that Agni, the beginning of the worlds, about the bricks, how many there are, and how they are to be laid.

original: sa cāpi tat pratyavadad yathoktam athāsya mṛtyuḥ punar āha tuṣṭaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: sa ca api tat pratyavadat yathā uktam atha asya mṛtyuḥ punar āha tuṣṭaḥ
translated: And he also replied to that as stated. Then Death, being pleased, again said to him.

original: idaṃ śruter vacanam /
analyzed: idam śruteḥ vacanam
translated: This is the statement of the Shruti.

original: lokādiṃ lokānām ādiṃ pratham aśarīritvād agniṃ taṃ prakṛtaṃ naciketasā prārthitam uvācoktavān mṛtyus tasmai naciketase /
analyzed: loka ādim lokānām ādim pratham aśarīri tvāt agnim tam prakṛtam naciketasā prārthitam uvāca uktavān mṛtyuḥ tasmai naciketase
translated: Death spoke to him, Nachiketa, about that Agni, the beginning of the worlds, the first, who is bodiless, and who was requested by Nachiketa.

original: kiñ ca yā iṣṭakāś cetavyāḥ svarūpeṇa /
analyzed: kim ca yāḥ iṣṭakāḥ cetavyāḥ sva rūpeṇa
translated: And what more, about the bricks which are to be laid, in their form.

original: yāvatīr vā saṅkhyayā /
analyzed: yāvatīḥ vā saṅkhyayā
translated: How many there are, by number.

original: yathā vā ciyate 'gnir yena prakāreṇa sarvam etad uktavān ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: yathā vā ciyate gniḥ yena prakāreṇa sarvam etat uktavān iti arthaḥ
translated: And how the Agni is to be laid, by what method - all this he spoke. This is the meaning.

original: sa cāpi naciketās tan mṛtyunoktaṃ pratyavadad yathāvat pratyayenāvadat pratyuccāritavān /
analyzed: sa ca api naciketāḥ tat mṛtyunā uktam pratyavadat yathāvat pratyayena avadat pratyuccāritavān
translated: And he also, Nachiketa, replied to that which was spoken by Death, as it is, with assent, he spoke in reply.

original: athāsya pratyuccāraṇena tuṣṭaḥ san mṛtyuḥ punar evāha varatrayavyatirekeṇānyaṃ varaṃ ditsuḥ // // / / //
analyzed: atha asya pratyuccāraṇena tuṣṭaḥ san mṛtyuḥ punar evā āha vara traya vyatirekeṇa anyam varam ditsuḥ
translated: Then Death, being pleased with his reciting it, again spoke, desiring to give him another boon, except the three boons (already granted).

original: tam abravīt prīyamāṇo mahātmā varaṃ tavehādya dadāmi bhūyaḥ /
analyzed: tam abravīt prīyamāṇaḥ mahātmā varam tava iha adya dadāmi bhūyas
translated: To him, pleased, the high-souled one said: I shall now give you another boon here.

original: tavaiva nāmnā bhavitāyam agniḥ sṛṅkāṃ cemām anekarūpāṃ gṛhāṇa // // / / //
analyzed: tava eva nāmnā bhavitā ayam agniḥ sṛṅkām ca imām aneka rūpām gṛhāṇa
translated: This fire shall be known by your own name. And accept this garland of various forms.

original: kathaṃ taṃ naciketasam abravīt prīyamāṇaḥ śiṣyasya yogyatāṃ paśyan prīyamāṇaḥ prītim
analyzed: katham tam naciketasam abravīt prīyamāṇaḥ śiṣyasya yogyatām paśyan prīyamāṇaḥ prītim
translated: How did he, pleased, speak to Nachiketa, seeing the fitness of the disciple, pleased, experiencing joy,

original: anubhavan mahātmākṣudrabuddhir varaṃ tava caturtham iha prītinimittam adyedānīṃ dadāmi
analyzed: anubhavan mahātmā akṣudra buddhiḥ varam tava caturtham iha prīti nimittam adyā idānīm dadāmi
translated: the high-souled one, of magnanimous mind, I shall now, for the sake of this joy, give you here a fourth boon.

original: bhūyaḥ punaḥ prayacchāmi /
analyzed: bhūyas punar prayacchāmi
translated: Again, I shall grant you another.

original: tavaiva naciketaso nāmnābhidhānena prasiddho bhavitā mayocyamāno 'yam agniḥ /
analyzed: tava eva naciketasaḥ nāmnā abhidhānena prasiddhaḥ bhavitā mayā ucyamānaḥ yam agniḥ
translated: This fire, which I am speaking of, shall be known by your own name, Nachiketa.

original: kiñ ca sṛṅkāṃ śabdavatīṃ ratnamayīṃ mālām imām anekarūpāṃ vicitrāṃ gṛhāṇa svīkuru /
analyzed: kim ca sṛṅkām śabdavatīm ratna mayīm mālām imām aneka rūpām vicitrām gṛhāṇa svīkuru
translated: And accept this garland, which is sonorous, full of jewels, of various forms, and variegated.

original: yad vā / sṛṅkām akutsitāṃ gatiṃ karmamayīṃ gṛhāṇa /
analyzed: yat vā sṛṅkām a kutsitām gatim karma mayīm gṛhāṇa
translated: Or, accept this garland, which is not despised, which is full of actions.

original: anyad api karmavijñānam anekaphalahetutvāt svīkurvity arthaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: anyat api karma vijñānam aneka phala hetu tvāt svīkuru iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it accepts other karma-knowledge also, because it has many fruits and causes.

original: punar api karmastutim evāha
analyzed: punar api karma stutim eva āha
translated: Again, he states the praise of karma:

original: triṇāciketas tribhir etya sandhiṃ trikarmakṛt tarati janmamṛtyū /
analyzed: triṇāciketaḥ tribhiḥ etya sandhim tri karma kṛt tarati janma mṛtyū
translated: The one who has thrice performed the Naciketas fire altar, having approached the three, the performer of the three actions, crosses birth and death.

original: brahmajajñaṃ devam īḍyaṃ viditvā nicāyyemāṃ śāntim atyantam eti // // / / //
analyzed: devam īḍyam viditvā nicāyya imām śāntim atyantam eti
translated: Having known and realized the god born from Brahman, worthy of worship, he goes to the highest peace.

original: triṇāciketas triḥkṛtvā nāciketo 'gniś cito yena sa triṇāciketas tadvijñānatadadhyayanatadanuṣṭhānavān vā /
analyzed: triṇāciketaḥ tris kṛtvā nāciketaḥ gniḥ citaḥ yena sa triṇāciketaḥ tad vijñāna tad adhyayana tad anuṣṭhānavān vā
translated: The one who has thrice performed the Naciketas fire altar is the one who has thrice performed the Naciketas fire altar. He who has that knowledge, has studied that, or has performed that.

original: tribhir mātṛpitrācāryair etya prāpya sandhiṃ sandhānaṃ sambandhaṃ mātrādyanuśāsanaṃ yathāvat prāpyety etat /
analyzed: tribhiḥ mātṛ pitṛ ācāryaiḥ etya prāpya sandhim sandhānam sambandham mātṛ ādi anuśāsanam yathāvat prāpya iti etat
translated: Having approached, having attained, the three - mother, father, and teacher - the connection, the union, the relationship, the proper attainment of the instruction of mother etc. This is what is meant.

original: tad dhi prāmāṇyakāraṇaṃ śrutyantarād avagamyate yathā mātṛmān pitṛmān BĀU / / ity ādeḥ /
analyzed: tat hi prāmāṇya kāraṇam śruti antarāt avagamyate yathā mātṛmān pitṛmān iti ādeḥ
translated: For that is the cause of validity, understood from another Vedic text, just as from the beginning of having a mother, having a father, etc.

original: vedasmṛtiśiṣṭair vā pratyakṣānumānāgamair vā /
analyzed: veda smṛti śiṣṭaiḥ vā pratyakṣa anumāna āgamaiḥ vā
translated: Or by the Vedas, Smritis, and the learned, or by perception, inference, and scripture.

original: tebhyo hi viśuddhiḥ pratyakṣā /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ hi viśuddhiḥ pratyakṣā
translated: For from them, purification is directly perceived.

original: trikarmakṛt ijyādhyayanadānānāṃ kartā taraty atikrāmati janmamṛtyū /
analyzed: tri karma kṛt ijyā adhyayana dānānām kartā tarati atikrāmati janma mṛtyū
translated: The performer of the three actions, the doer of sacrifice, study, and giving, crosses, goes beyond, birth and death.

original: kiñ ca brahmajajñaṃ brahmaṇo hiraṇyagarbhāj jāto brahmajaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca brahmajajñam brahmaṇaḥ hiraṇyagarbhāt jātaḥ brahmajaḥ
translated: And further, Brahma-yoni means born from Brahma, born from Hiranyagarbha.

original: brahmajaś cāsau jñaś ceti brahmajajñaḥ sarvajño hy asau /
analyzed: brahma jaḥ ca asau jñaḥ ca iti brahma ja jñaḥ sarva jñaḥ hi asau
translated: And he is Brahma-yoni, and he is jna, therefore Brahma-yoni. For he is omniscient.

original: taṃ devaṃ dyotanāñ jñānādiguṇavantam īḍyaṃ stutyaṃ viditvā śāstrato /
analyzed: tam devam dyotanām jñāna ādi guṇavantam īḍyam stutyam viditvā
translated: Having known that God, who possesses the qualities of illumination, knowledge, etc., who is worthy of praise, who is to be worshipped, through the scriptures,

original: nicāyya dṛṣṭvā cātmabhāvenemāṃ svabuddhipratyakṣāṃ śāntim uparatim atyantam ety atiśayenaiti /
analyzed: nicāyya dṛṣṭvā ca ātma bhāvena imām sva buddhi pratyakṣām śāntim uparatim atyantam eti atiśayena eti
translated: having realized, having seen by one's own nature, one attains this peace, cessation, to a very high degree, by one's own intellect and direct perception.

original: vairājaṃ padaṃ jñānakarmasamuccayānuṣṭhānena prāpnotīty arthaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: vairājam padam jñāna karma samuccaya anuṣṭhānena prāpnoti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that one attains the state of the Supreme Self by the performance of the combination of knowledge and action.

original: idānīm agnivijñānacayanaphalam upasaṃharati prakaraṇa ca
analyzed: idānīm agni vijñāna cayana phalam upasaṃharati ca
translated: Now, he concludes the result of the knowledge of the fire-altar and the piling up of the altar in the context

original: triṇāciketas trayam etad viditvā ya evaṃ vidvāṃś cinute nāciketam /
analyzed: triṇāciketaḥ trayam etat viditvā yaḥ evam vidvān cinute nāciketam
translated: The Tri-Naich-ketas, having known these three, he who, knowing thus, piles up the Naich-ketas,

original: sa mṛtyupāśān purataḥ praṇodya śokātigo modate svargaloke // // / / //
analyzed: sa mṛtyu pāśān puratas praṇodya śoka atigaḥ modate svarga loke
translated: having removed the bonds of death in front, being free from sorrow, rejoices in the heavenly world.

original: triṇāciketas trayaṃ yathoktaṃ yā iṣṭakā yāvatīrvā yathā vā KaU /
analyzed: triṇāciketaḥ trayam yathā uktam yāḥ iṣṭakāḥ yāvatīḥ vā yathā vā kau
translated: The Tri-Naich-ketas, the three as stated, the bricks, how many, and how, KaU.

original: ity etad viditvāvagamya yaś caivam ātmarūpeṇāgniṃ vidvāṃś cinute nirvartayati nāciketam
analyzed: iti etat viditvā avagamya yaḥ ca evam ātma rūpeṇa agnim vidvān cinute nirvartayati nāciketam
translated: Having known this, having understood, and he who, knowing thus, piles up, accomplishes, the Naich-ketas, in the form of the Self,

original: agniṃ kratuṃ sa mṛtyupāśān adharmājñānarāgadveṣādilakṣaṇān purato 'grataḥ pūrvam
analyzed: agnim kratum sa mṛtyu pāśān adharma ajñāna rāga dveṣa ādi lakṣaṇān puratas gratas pūrvam
translated: Agni, the sacrifice, he, the bonds of death, characterized by ignorance, attachment, aversion, etc., in front, in front, first,

original: eva śarīrapātād ity arthaḥ praṇodyāpahāya śokātigo mānasair duḥkhair varjita ity
analyzed: eva śarīrapātāt iti arthaḥ praṇodya apahāya śoka atigaḥ mānasaiḥ duḥkhaiḥ varjitaḥ iti
translated: Agni, the sacrifice, the bonds of death, characterized by unrighteousness, ignorance, attachment, aversion, etc., he has sent away, cast off, even before the fall of the body. This is the meaning. Being free from grief, being devoid of mental sorrows,

original: etan modate svargaloke vairāje virāḍātmasvarūpapratipattyā // // / / //
analyzed: etat modate svarga loke vairāje virāj ātma svarūpa pratipattyā
translated: he rejoices in the heavenly world of Brahman, by attaining the nature of the Supreme Self.

original: eṣa te 'gnir naciketaḥ svargyo yam avṛṇīthā dvitīyena vareṇa /
analyzed: eṣa te gniḥ naciketaḥ svargyaḥ yam avṛṇīthāḥ dvitīyena vareṇa
translated: This is your heavenly fire, O Naciketas, which you have chosen as the second boon.

original: etam agniṃ tavaiva pravakṣyanti janāsas tṛtīyaṃ varaṃ naciketo vṛṇīṣva // // / / //
analyzed: etam agnim tava eva pravakṣyanti janāsaḥ tṛtīyam varam naciketaḥ vṛṇīṣva
translated: People will speak of this fire as yours. Choose a third boon, O Naciketas.

original: eṣa te tubhyam agnir varo he naciketaḥ /
analyzed: eṣa te tubhyam agniḥ varaḥ he naciketaḥ
translated: This is your fire, O Naciketas.

original: svargyaḥ svargasādhano yam agniṃ varam avṛṇīthāḥ prārthitavānasi dvitīyena vareṇa /
analyzed: svargyaḥ svarga sādhanaḥ yam agnim varam avṛṇīthāḥ prārthitavān asi dvitīyena vareṇa
translated: It is heavenly, a means of attaining heaven, which fire you have chosen as the second boon.

original: so 'gnir varo datta ity uktopasaṃhāraḥ /
analyzed: saḥ agniḥ varaḥ dattaḥ iti ukta upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: That fire is given as a boon. This is the conclusion of what was stated.

original: kiñ caitam agniṃ tavaiva nāmnā pravakṣyanti janāso janā ity etat /
analyzed: kim ca etam agnim tava eva nāmnā pravakṣyanti janāsaḥ janāḥ iti etat
translated: And people will speak of this fire by your very name. People - this is what is meant.

original: eṣa varo datto mayā caturthas tuṣṭena /
analyzed: eṣa varaḥ dattaḥ mayā caturthaḥ tuṣṭena
translated: This boon is given by me, being pleased.

original: tṛtīyaṃ varaṃ naciketo vṛṇīṣva /
analyzed: tṛtīyam varam naciketaḥ vṛṇīṣva
translated: Choose a third boon, O Naciketas.

original: tasmin hy adatta ṛṇavān evāham ity ābhiprāyaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: tasmin hi a datte ṛṇavān eva aham iti
translated: The idea is that in that (knowledge of the Self), I am not a debtor.

original: etāvad dhy atikrāntena vidhipratiṣedhārthena mantrabrāhmaṇenāvagantavyaṃ yadvaradvayasūcitaṃ vastu nātmatattvaviṣayayāthātmyavijñānam /
analyzed: etāvat dhi atikrāntena vidhi pratiṣedha arthena mantra brāhmaṇena avagantavyam yat vara dvaya sūcitam vastu na ātma tattva viṣaya yāthātmya vijñānam
translated: For this much is to be understood by the injunctions and prohibitions contained in the Mantras and Brahmanas, that the thing indicated by the two boons is not the knowledge of the true nature of the Self.

original: ato vidhipratiṣedhārthaviṣayasyātmani kriyākārakaphalādhyāropaṇalakṣaṇasya svābhāvikasyājñānasya
analyzed: atas vidhi pratiṣedha artha viṣayasya ātmani kriyā kāraka phala adhyāropaṇa lakṣaṇasya svābhāvikasya ajñānasya
translated: Therefore, for the cessation of the natural ignorance characterized by the superimposition of action, agent, and result on the Self, which has for its object the injunctions and prohibitions,

original: saṃsārabījasya nivṛttyarthaṃ tadviparītabrahmātmaikatvavijñānaṃ kriyākārakaphalādhyāropaṇalakṣaṇaśūnyam
analyzed: saṃsāra bījasya nivṛtti artham tad viparīta brahma ātma ekatva vijñānam kriyā kāraka phala adhyāropaṇa lakṣaṇa śūnyam
translated: and which is the seed of worldly existence, the knowledge of the non-dual Brahman as the Self, devoid of the superimposition of action, agent, and result,

original: ātyantikaniḥśreyasaprayojanaṃ vaktavyam ity uttaro grantha ārabhyate /
analyzed: ātyantika niḥśreyasa prayojanam vaktavyam iti uttaraḥ granthaḥ ārabhyate
translated: which has the highest good as its purpose, should be taught. Thus the subsequent text is begun.

original: tam etam arthaṃ dvitīyavaraprāptyāpy akṛtārthatvaṃ tṛtīyavaragocaram ātmajñānam antareṇa ity ākhyāyikayā prapañcayati
analyzed: tam etam artham dvitīya vara prāptyā api akṛtārtha tvam tṛtīya vara gocaram ātma jñānam antareṇa iti ākhyāyikayā prapañcayati
translated: In order to show that the purpose of that (knowledge of the Self) is not accomplished even by obtaining the second boon, and that it is the sphere of the third boon, he elaborates on it through a story:

original: yeyaṃ prete vicikitsā manuṣye astīty eke nāyam astīti caike /
analyzed: yā iyam prete vicikitsā manuṣye asti iti eke na ayam asti iti ca eke
translated: This doubt about the dead person, whether he exists or not, some say he exists, others say he does not.

original: etad vidyām anuśiṣṭas tvayāhaṃ varāṇām eṣa varas tṛtīyaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: etat vidyām anuśiṣṭaḥ tvayā aham varāṇām eṣa varaḥ tṛtīyaḥ
translated: This knowledge, instructed by you, is my third boon among the boons.

original: yataḥ pūrvasmāt karmagocarāt sādhyasādhanalakṣaṇād anityād viraktasyātmajñāne 'dhikāra iti tannindārtha putrādyupanyāsena pralobhanaṃ kriyate
analyzed: yatas pūrvasmāt karma gocarāt sādhya sādhana lakṣaṇāt anityāt viraktasya ātma jñāne dhikāraḥ iti tad nindā artha putra ādi upanyāsena pralobhanam kriyate
translated: Since it is said that one who is detached from the impermanent realm of action characterized by the accomplishment of what is to be done is qualified for the knowledge of the self, in order to criticize that [realm of action], enticement is made by mentioning sons and so on.

original: naciketā uvāca tṛtīyaṃ varaṃ naciketo vṛṇīṣva KaU /
analyzed: naciketāḥ uvāca tṛtīyam varam naciketaḥ vṛṇīṣva kau
translated: Naciketas said: O Death, choose a third boon.

original: ity uktaḥ san yeyaṃ vicikitsā saṃśayaḥ prete mṛte manuṣye /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ san yā iyam vicikitsā saṃśayaḥ prete mṛte manuṣye
translated: Having been told thus, this doubt arises regarding a dead person:

original: astīty eke 'sti śarīrendriyamanobuddhivyatirikto dehāntarasambandhyātmety eke manyante /🔽nāyam astīti caike /
analyzed: asti iti eke sti śarīra indriya manaḥ buddhi vyatiriktaḥ deha antara sambandhī ātmā iti eke manyante  na ayam asti iti ca eke
translated: Some think that there is a self connected to another body, separate from the body, senses, mind and intellect.🔽Some say this does not exist.

original: nāyam evaṃvidho 'stīti caike /
analyzed: na ayam evaṃvidhaḥ asti iti ca eke
translated: Some say there is no such thing.

original: ataś cāsmākaṃ na pratyakṣeṇa nāpi vānumānena nirṇayavijñānam /
analyzed: atas ca asmākam na pratyakṣeṇa na api vā anumānena nirṇaya vijñānam
translated: And therefore, we do not have the knowledge of certainty either through perception or through inference.

original: etad vijñānādhīno hi paraḥ puruṣārtha ity ata etad vidyāṃ vijānīyām aham anuśiṣṭo jñāpitas tvayā /
analyzed: etat vijñāna adhīnaḥ hi paraḥ puruṣa arthaḥ iti atas etat vidyām vijānīyām aham anuśiṣṭaḥ jñāpitaḥ tvayā
translated: Since the highest human goal depends on the knowledge of this [self], therefore, I should know this knowledge, instructed and made known by you.

original: varāṇām eṣa varas tṛtīyo 'vaśiṣṭaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: varāṇām eṣa varaḥ tṛtīyaḥ vaśiṣṭaḥ
translated: This is the remaining third boon among the boons.

original: kim ayam ekāntato niḥśreyasasādhanātmajñānārho na vety etat parīkṣaṇārtham āha
analyzed: kim ayam ekāntataḥ niḥśreyasa sādhana ātma jñāna arhaḥ na vā iti etat parīkṣaṇa artham āha
translated: In order to examine whether this knowledge of the Self, which is the means of attaining absolute beatitude, is fit to be known or not, he says:

original: devair atrāpi vicikitsitaṃ purā na hi sujñeyam aṇur eṣa dharmaḥ /
analyzed: devaiḥ atrā api vicikitsitam purā na hi su jñeyam aṇuḥ eṣa dharmaḥ
translated: Even the gods had doubts about this in the past; for this subtle truth is not easily understood.

original: anyaṃ varaṃ naciketo vṛṇīṣva mā moparotsīr ati mā sṛjainam // // / / //
analyzed: anyam varam naciketaḥ vṛṇīṣva mā mā uparotsīḥ ati mā sṛja enam
translated: O Naciketas, choose another boon; do not insist on this, do not force me to give it to you.

original: devair apy atraitasmin vastuni vicikitsitaṃ saṃśayitaṃ purā pūrvam /
analyzed: devaiḥ api atra etasmin vastuni vicikitsitam saṃśayitam purā pūrvam
translated: Even the gods had doubts, were uncertain, about this matter in the past.

original: na hi suvijñeyaṃ suṣṭhu jñeyam asakṛt śrutam api prākṛtair janair yato 'ṇuḥ sūkṣma eṣa ātmākhyo dharmaḥ /
analyzed: na hi su vijñeyam suṣṭhu jñeyam asakṛt śrutam api prākṛtaiḥ janaiḥ yatas ṇuḥ sūkṣmaḥ eṣaḥ ātma ākhyaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: For this subtle, minute truth called the Self is not easily understood, not well known, even though it has been heard many times by ordinary people.

original: ato 'nyam asan digdhaphalaṃ varaṃ naciketo vṛṇīṣva /
analyzed: atas digdha phalam varam naciketaḥ vṛṇīṣva
translated: Therefore, O Naciketas, choose another boon that is not mixed with results.

original: mā moparotsīr uparodhaṃ mā kārṣīr adharmaṇam ivottamarṇaḥ /
analyzed: mā mā uparotsīḥ uparodham mā kārṣīḥ adharmaṇam iva uttamarṇaḥ
translated: Do not insist, do not force me to give it, as a creditor does to a debtor.

original: atisṛja vimuñcainaṃ varaṃ mā māṃ prati // // / / //
analyzed: atisṛja vimuñca enam varam mā mām prati
translated: Release, let go of this boon, do not give it to me.

original: evam ukto naciketā āha
analyzed: evam uktaḥ naciketāḥ āha
translated: Thus addressed, Naciketas said:

original: devair atrāpi vicikitsitaṃ kila tvaṃ ca mṛtyo yan na sujñeyam āttha /
analyzed: devaiḥ atrā api vicikitsitam kila tvam ca mṛtyo yat na su jñeyam āttha
translated: Even the gods had doubts about this, it seems; and you, O Death, have said that it is not easily understood.

original: vaktā cāsya tvādṛg anyo na labhyo nānyo varas tulya etasya kaścit // // / / //
analyzed: vaktā ca asya tvādṛś anyaḥ na labhyaḥ na anyaḥ varaḥ tulyaḥ etasya kaścid
translated: And a speaker of this (truth) like you is not to be found, and no other boon is equal to this.

original: devair atrāpy etasmin vastuni vicikitsitaṃ kileti bhavata eva naḥ śrutam /
analyzed: devaiḥ atrā api etasmin vastuni vicikitsitam kila iti bhavataḥ eva naḥ śrutam
translated: We have heard from you itself that even the gods had doubts about this matter here.

original: tvaṃ ca mṛtyo yady asmān na sujñeyam ātmatattvam āttha kathayasi /
analyzed: tvam ca mṛtyo yadi asmāt na su jñeyam ātma tattvam āttha kathayasi
translated: And you, O Death, if you do not tell us the well-known truth about the Self,

original: ataḥ paṇḍitair apy avadanīyatvād vaktā cāsya dharmasya tvādṛk tvattulyo 'nyaḥ paṇḍitaś ca na labhyo 'nviṣyamāṇo 'py ayaṃ tu varo niḥśreyasaprāptihetuḥ
analyzed: atas paṇḍitaiḥ api a vadanīya tvāt vaktā ca asya dharmasya tvādṛś tvad tulyaḥ nyaḥ paṇḍitaḥ ca na labhyaḥ nviṣyamāṇaḥ pi ayam tu varaḥ niḥśreyasa prāpti hetuḥ
translated: Therefore, since it should be spoken by even the wise, and a speaker of this dharma like you, another wise one equal to you, is not to be found even if sought, but this boon is the cause of attaining the highest good,

original: ato nānyo varas tulyaḥ sadṛśo 'sty etasya kaścid apy /
analyzed: atas nā anyaḥ varaḥ tulyaḥ sadṛśaḥ sti etasya kaścid api
translated: Therefore, no other boon is equal to this, none at all.

original: anityaphalatvād anyasya sarvasyaivety abhiprāyaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: anitya phala tvāt anyasya sarvasya eva iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that because of having an impermanent result, all others are (impermanent).

original: evam ukto 'pi punaḥ pralobhayann uvāca mṛtyuḥ
analyzed: evam uktaḥ pi punar pralobhayan uvāca mṛtyuḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Death, tempting him again, said:

original: śatāyuṣaḥ putrapautrān vṛṇīṣva bahūn paśūn hastihiraṇyam aśvān /
analyzed: śata āyuṣaḥ putra pautrān vṛṇīṣva bahūn paśūn hasti hiraṇyam aśvān
translated: Choose sons, grandsons, and many cattle, elephants, gold, and horses, for a life of a hundred years.

original: bhūmer mahad āyatanaṃ vṛṇīṣva svayaṃ ca jīva śarado yāvad icchasi // // / / //
analyzed: bhūmeḥ mahat āyatanam vṛṇīṣva svayam ca jīva śaradaḥ yāvat icchasi
translated: Choose a great abode on earth, and live yourself for as many autumns as you desire.

original: śatāyuṣaḥ śataṃ varṣāṇy āyūṃṣi yeṣāṃ tān śatāyuṣaḥ putrapautrān vṛṇīṣva /
analyzed: śata āyuṣaḥ śatam varṣāṇi āyūṃṣi yeṣām tān śata āyuṣaḥ putra pautrān vṛṇīṣva
translated: Choose sons and grandsons who will live for a hundred years, for a hundred years is the life-span of those who live for a hundred years.

original: kiñ ca gavādilakṣaṇān bahūn paśūn /
analyzed: kim ca go ādi lakṣaṇān bahūn paśūn
translated: And also many cattle, characterized by cows and so on.

original: hastihiraṇyaṃ hastī ca hiraṇyaṃ ca hastihiraṇyam / aśvāṃś ca /
analyzed: hasti hiraṇyam hastī ca hiraṇyam ca hasti hiraṇyam aśvān ca
translated: Elephants and gold, elephants and gold are elephant-gold. And horses.

original: kiñ ca bhūmeḥ pṛthivyā mahad vistīrṇam āyatanam āśrayaṃ maṇḍalaṃ sāmrājyaṃ vṛṇīṣva /
analyzed: kim ca bhūmeḥ pṛthivyāḥ mahat vistīrṇam āyatanam āśrayam maṇḍalam sāmrājyam vṛṇīṣva
translated: And also choose a great, extensive abode, a support, a realm of sovereignty, of the earth.

original: kiñ ca sarvam apy etad anarthakaṃ svayaṃ ced alpāyur ity ata āha svayaṃ ca tvaṃ
analyzed: kim ca sarvam api etat anarthakam svayam ced alpa āyuḥ iti atas āha svayam ca tvam
translated: And also all this is useless if you yourself have a short life. Therefore he says: You yourself

original: jīva dhāraya śarīraṃ samagrendriyakalāpaṃ śarado varṣāṇi yāvad icchasi jīvitum //
analyzed: jīva dhāraya śarīram samagra indriya kalāpam śaradaḥ varṣāṇi yāvat icchasi jīvitum
translated: live, support your body with all the faculties intact, for as many years as you wish to live, for a hundred autumns.

original: etat tulyaṃ yadi manyase varaṃ vṛṇīṣva vittaṃ cirajīvikāṃ ca /
analyzed: etat tulyam yadi manyase varam vṛṇīṣva vittam cira jīvikām ca
translated: If you consider this equal, choose wealth and longevity.

original: mahābhūmau naciketas tvam edhi kāmānāṃ tvā kāmabhājaṃ karomi // // / / //
analyzed: mahā bhūmau naciketaḥ tvam edhi kāmānām tvā kāma bhājam karomi
translated: On the great earth, O Naciketas, you will prosper. I make you a partaker of desires, of all desires.

original: etat tulyam etena yathopadiṣṭena sadṛśamanyam api yadi manyase varaṃ tam api vṛṇīṣva /
analyzed: etat tulyam etena yathā upadiṣṭena sadṛśam anyam api yadi manyase varam tam api vṛṇīṣva
translated: If you consider this equal, similar to what has been taught, any other boon also, choose that.

original: kiñ ca vittaṃ prabhūtaṃ hiraṇyaratnādi cirajīvikāṃ ca saha vittena vṛṇīṣvety etat /
analyzed: kim ca vittam prabhūtam hiraṇya ratna ādi cira jīvikām ca saha vittena vṛṇīṣva iti etat
translated: And also, choose much wealth, gold, jewels, etc., and a long life, along with the wealth.

original: kiṃ bahunā / mahābhūmau mahatyāṃ bhūmau rājā naciketas tvam edhi bhava /
analyzed: kim bahunā mahā bhūmau mahatyām bhūmau rājā naciketaḥ tvam edhi bhava
translated: What more? Be a king on a great earth, a great land, O Naciketas.

original: kiñ cānyat kāmānāṃ divyānāṃ mānuṣāṇāṃ ca tvā tvāṃ kāmabhājaṃ kāmabhāginaṃ kāmārhaṃ karomi /
analyzed: kim ca anyat kāmānām divyānām mānuṣāṇām ca tvā tvām kāma bhājam kāma bhāginam kāma arham karomi
translated: And also, I make you an enjoyer of desires, a partaker of desires, one deserving desires, both divine and human.

original: satyasaṅkalapo hy ahaṃ devaḥ // // / / //
analyzed: satya saṅkalapaḥ hi aham devaḥ
translated: For I am a god who keeps his promises.

original: ye ye kāmā durlabhā martyaloke sarvān kāmāṃś chandataḥ prārthayasva /
analyzed: ye ye kāmāḥ durlabhāḥ martya loke sarvān kāmān chandataḥ prārthayasva
translated: Whatever desires are difficult to obtain in the world of mortals, ask for all those desires as you wish.

original: imā rāmāḥ sarathāḥ satūryā na hīdṛśā lambhanīyā manuṣyaiḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ rāmāḥ sa rathāḥ sa tūryāḥ na hi īdṛśāḥ lambhanīyāḥ manuṣyaiḥ
translated: These beautiful women with their chariots and their musical instruments, which cannot be obtained by men,

original: ābhir matprattābhiḥ paricārayasva naciketo maraṇaṃ mānuprākṣīḥ // // / / //
analyzed: ābhiḥ mad prattābhiḥ paricārayasva naciketaḥ maraṇam mā anuprākṣīḥ
translated: serve you with these, given by me, O Naciketas, and do not ask for death again.

original: ye ye kāmāḥ prārthanīyā durlabhāś ca matryaloke sarvās tān kāmāñ chandata icchātaḥ prārthayasva /
analyzed: ye ye kāmāḥ prārthanīyāḥ durlabhāḥ ca matrya loke sarvāḥ tān chandataḥ icchātaḥ prārthayasva
translated: Whatever desires are to be asked for and are difficult to obtain in the world of mortals, ask for all those desires as you wish.

original: kiñ cemā divyā apsaraso /
analyzed: kim ca imāḥ divyāḥ apsarasaḥ
translated: And also, these are divine celestial nymphs.

original: ramayanti puruṣān iti rāmāḥ /
analyzed: ramayanti puruṣān iti rāmāḥ
translated: They delight men, therefore they are beautiful women.

original: saha rathair vartanta iti sarathāḥ /
analyzed: saha rathaiḥ vartante iti sa rathāḥ
translated: They go along with chariots, therefore they are with chariots.

original: satūryāḥ savāditrāḥ /
analyzed: sa tūryāḥ sa vāditrāḥ
translated: They have musical instruments, therefore they are with musical instruments.

original: tāś ca na hi lambhanīyāḥ prāpaṇīyā īdṛśā evaṃvidhā manuṣyair matyair asmadādiprasādam antareṇa /
analyzed: tāḥ ca na hi lambhanīyāḥ prāpaṇīyāḥ īdṛśāḥ evaṃvidhāḥ manuṣyaiḥ matyaiḥ asmad ādi prasādam antareṇa
translated: And those of this kind cannot be obtained, cannot be brought about by men, by mortals, without the grace of one like me.

original: ābhir matprattābhir mayā pradattābhiḥ paricāriṇībhiḥ paricārayasvātmānam /
analyzed: ābhiḥ mad prattābhiḥ mayā pradattābhiḥ paricāriṇībhiḥ paricārayasva ātmānam
translated: With these attendants given by me, given by me, serve yourself.

original: pādaprakṣālanādiśuśrūṣāṃ kārayātmana ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: pāda prakṣālana ādi śuśrūṣām kāraya ātmanaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: have the service of washing the feet etc. done for yourself.

original: naciketo / maraṇaṃ maraṇasambaddhaṃ praśnaṃ prete 'sti nāstīti kākadantaparīkṣārūpaṃ mānuprākṣīr maivaṃ praṣṭum arhasi // // / /
analyzed: naciketaḥ maraṇam maraṇa sambaddham praśnam prete sti na asti iti kākadanta parīkṣā rūpam mā anuprākṣīḥ mā evam praṣṭum arhasi  /
translated: O Naciketas, you asked a question about death, whether the dead exist or not, which is like the examination of a crow's teeth. You should not ask in this way.

original: evaṃ pralobhyamāno 'pi naciketā mahāhradavadakṣobhya āha
analyzed: evam pralobhyamānaḥ naciketāḥ mahāhrada vat akṣobhyaḥ āha
translated: Even though thus tempted, Naciketas, unshaken like a great lake, said:

original: śvobhāvā martyasya yad antakaitat sarvendriyāṇāṃ jarayanti tejaḥ /
analyzed: śvobhāvāḥ martyasya yat antaka etat sarva indriyāṇām jarayanti tejaḥ
translated: O Death, all these [sense] organs of a mortal man diminish his vigor, which will be in the future.

original: api sarvaṃ jīvitam alpam eva tavaiva vāhās tava nṛtyagīte // // / / //
analyzed: api sarvam jīvitam alpam eva tava eva vāhāḥ tava nṛtya gīte
translated: Even all life is very short. Your very vehicles, your dancing and singing, O Death, will be in the future.

original: śvo bhaviṣyanti na bhaviṣyanti veti sandihyamāna eva yeṣāṃ bhāvo bhavanaṃ tvayopanyastānāṃ bhogānāṃ te śvobhāvāḥ /
analyzed: śvas bhaviṣyanti na bhaviṣyanti vā iti sandihyamānaḥ eva yeṣām bhāvaḥ bhavanam tvayā upanyastānām bhogānām te śvobhāvāḥ
translated: And further, O Death, those things whose existence, becoming, you have presented as enjoyments, are uncertain whether they will be in the future or not.

original: kiñ ca matryasya manuṣyasyāntaka he mṛtyo /
analyzed: kim ca matryasya manuṣyasya antaka he mṛtyo
translated: And what is this? Of a mortal man, O Death.

original: yad etat sarvendriyāṇāṃ tejas taj jarayanty apakṣayanty apsaraḥprabhṛtayo bhogā anarthāyaivate dharmavīryaprajñātejoyaśaḥprabhṛtīnāṃ kṣapayitṛtvāt
analyzed: yat etat sarva indriyāṇām tejaḥ tat jarayanti apakṣayanti apsaraḥ prabhṛtayaḥ bhogāḥ dharma vīrya prajñā tejaḥ yaśaḥ prabhṛtīnām kṣapayitṛ tvāt
translated: because they cause the destruction of dharma, energy, wisdom, splendor, fame, etc.

original: yāṃ cāpi dīrghajīvikāṃ tvaṃ ditsasi tatrāpi śṛṇu /
analyzed: yām ca api dīrgha jīvikām tvam ditsasi tatra api śṛṇu
translated: And as for that long life you wish to give, listen to that too.

original: sarvaṃ yad brahmaṇo 'pi jīvitam āyur alpam eva /
analyzed: sarvam yat brahmaṇaḥ u pi jīvitam āyuḥ alpam eva
translated: All that life, even of Brahma, is very short.

original: kim utāsmadādidīrghajīvikā /
analyzed: kim uta asmad ādi dīrgha jīvikā
translated: How much more so the long life of one like us.

original: atas tavaiva tiṣṭhantu vāhā rathādayas tathā tava nṛtyagīte ca // // / / //
analyzed: atas tava eva tiṣṭhantu vāhāḥ ratha ādayaḥ tathā tava nṛtya gīte ca
translated: Therefore, let your vehicles, chariots, etc. remain with you, and also your dancing and singing, etc.

original: na vittena tarpaṇīyo manuṣyo lapsyāmahe vittam adrākṣma cet tvā /
analyzed: na vittena tarpaṇīyaḥ manuṣyaḥ lapsyāmahe vittam adrākṣma ced tvā
translated: A man cannot be satisfied with wealth. If we obtain wealth and see you,

original: jīviṣyāmo yāvad īśiṣyasi tvaṃ varas tu me varaṇīyaḥ sa eva // // / / //
analyzed: jīviṣyāmaḥ yāvat īśiṣyasi tvam varaḥ tu me varaṇīyaḥ saḥ eva
translated: we will live as long as you rule. But that very boon is to be chosen by me.

original: kiñ ca na prabhūtena vittena tarpaṇīyo manuṣyaḥ /
analyzed: kim ca na prabhūtena vittena tarpaṇīyaḥ manuṣyaḥ
translated: Moreover, a man cannot be satisfied with abundant wealth.

original: na hi loke vittalābhaḥ kasyacit tṛptikaro dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: na hi loke vitta lābhaḥ kasyacid tṛpti karaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: For in the world, the acquisition of wealth is not seen to bring satisfaction to anyone.

original: yadi nāmāsmākaṃ vittatṛṣṇā syāl lapsyāmahe prāpsyāmahe vittam adrākṣma dṛṣṭavanto vayaṃ cet tvā tvām /
analyzed: yadi nāma asmākam vitta tṛṣṇā syāt lapsyāmahe prāpsyāmahe vittam adrākṣma dṛṣṭavantaḥ vayam ced tvā tvām
translated: If we had a craving for wealth, we would obtain it, we would acquire it, if we saw you.

original: jīvitam api tathaiva /
analyzed: jīvitam api tathā eva
translated: Life is also the same.

original: jīviṣyāmo yāvad yāmye pade tvam īśiṣyasīśiṣyase prabhuḥ syāḥ /
analyzed: jīviṣyāmaḥ yāvat yāmye pade tvam īśiṣyasi īśiṣyase prabhuḥ syāḥ
translated: We shall live as long as you will be the lord in the world of Yama.

original: kathaṃ hi martyas tvayā sametyālpadhanāyur bhavet /
analyzed: katham hi martyaḥ tvayā sametya alpa dhana āyuḥ bhavet
translated: For how can a mortal, having met you, have a short life and little wealth?

original: varas tu me varaṇīyaḥ sa eva yadātmavijñānam // // / / //
analyzed: varaḥ tu me varaṇīyaḥ saḥ eva yat ātma vijñānam
translated: But that very boon is to be chosen by me, namely self-knowledge.

original: ajīryatām amṛtānām upetya jīryan martyaḥ kvadhaḥsthaḥ prajānan /
analyzed: ajīryatām amṛtānām upetya jīryan martyaḥ ku adhaḥsthaḥ prajānan
translated: Having approached the undecaying, immortal ones, the mortal who decays, dwelling below, knowing this,

original: abhidhyāyan varṇaratipramodān atidīrghe jīvite ko rameta // // / / //🔽yataś cājīryatāṃ vayohāṇim aprāpnuvatām amṛtānāṃ sakāśam upetyopagamyātmana utkṛṣṭaṃ
analyzed: abhidhyāyan varṇa rati pramodān ati dīrghe jīvite kaḥ rameta  yatas ca a jīryatām vayaḥ hāṇim a prāpnuvatām amṛtānām sakāśam upetya upagamya ātmanaḥ utkṛṣṭam
translated: contemplating the joys of beauty and pleasure, who would delight in a very long life?

original: prayojanāntaraṃ prāptavyaṃ tebhyaḥ prajānann upalabhamānaḥ svayaṃ tu jīryan martyo
analyzed: prayojana antaram prāptavyam tebhyaḥ prajānan upalabhamānaḥ svayam tu jīryan martyaḥ
translated: And since, having approached the immortal ones who have not attained the decay of age, having gone to them, knowing that there is a higher purpose to be attained from them, oneself being mortal,

original: jarāmaraṇavān kvadhaḥsthaḥ kuḥ pṛthivy adhaś cāsāv āntarikṣādilokāpekṣayā tasyāṃ
analyzed: jarā maraṇavān ku adhas sthaḥ kuḥ pṛthivī adhas ca asau āntarikṣa ādi loka apekṣayā tasyām
translated: decaying, having old age and death, dwelling below, ku is the earth, and he is below in relation to the heavenly and other worlds, dwelling on that,

original: tiṣṭhatīti kvadhaḥsthaḥ san katham evam avivekibhiḥ prārthanīyaṃ putravittādyasthiraṃ vṛṇīte /
analyzed: tiṣṭhati iti ku adhas sthaḥ san katham evam avivekibhiḥ prārthanīyam putra vitta ādi asthiram vṛṇīte
translated: how does he, dwelling thus below, choose what is to be desired by the non-discriminating ones, the unstable like sons, wealth, etc.?

original: kva tadāsthaḥ iti vā pāṭhāntaram /
analyzed: kva tad āsthaḥ iti vā pāṭha antaram
translated: Or the reading may be kva tadāsthaḥ.

original: asmin pakṣe caivam akṣarayojanā teṣu putrādiṣv āsthā sthitis tātparyeṇa vartanaṃ yasya sa tadāsthaḥ /
analyzed: asmin pakṣe ca evam akṣara yojanā teṣu putra ādiṣu āsthā sthitiḥ tātparyeṇa vartanam yasya sa tad āsthaḥ
translated: And in this view, the interpretation of the syllable is as follows: He who has a strong attachment to those sons etc., who lives with a strong sense of ownership towards them,

original: tato 'dhikataraṃ puruṣārthaṃ duṣprāpam api prāpipayiṣuḥ kva tadāstho bhavet /
analyzed: tatas dhikataram puruṣa artham duṣprāpam api prāpipayiṣuḥ kva tad āsthaḥ bhavet
translated: desiring to attain a human goal superior to that, even if difficult to attain, where would he have a strong attachment?

original: na kaścit tadasārajñas tadarthī syād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: na kaścid tad asāra jñaḥ tad arthī syāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that no one who knows it to be worthless would desire it.

original: sarvo hy uparyuparyeva bubhūṣati lokas tasmān na putravittādilobhaiḥ pralobhyo 'ham /
analyzed: sarvaḥ hi upari upari eva bubhūṣati lokaḥ tasmāt na putra vitta ādi lobhaiḥ pralobhyaḥ ham
translated: For everyone desires to be higher and higher. Therefore, I should not be tempted by greed for sons, wealth, etc.

original: kiñ cāpsaraḥ pramukhān varṇaratipramodānanavasthitarūpatayābhidhyāyannirūpayanyathāvad atidīrghe jīvite ko vivekī rameta // // / /
analyzed: kim ca apsaraḥ pramukhān varṇa rati pramodān anavasthita rūpa tayā abhidhyāyan nirūpayan yathāvat ati dīrghe jīvite kaḥ vivekī rameta  /
translated: Moreover, contemplating and examining the pleasures of sensual enjoyment and beauty that are not permanent, in such a very long life, who would delight, being discerning?

original: yasminn idaṃ vicikitsanti mṛtyo yat sāmparāye mahati brūhi nas tat /
analyzed: yasmin idam vicikitsanti mṛtyo yat sāmparāye mahati brūhi naḥ tat
translated: O Death, they doubt about this in the next world, the great one. Tell us that.

original: yo 'yaṃ varo gūḍham anupraviṣṭo nānyaṃ tasmān naciketā vṛṇīte // // / / //
analyzed: yaḥ yam varaḥ gūḍham anupraviṣṭaḥ na anyam tasmāt naciketāḥ vṛṇīte
translated: This boon that has entered secretly, Nārada does not choose any other than that.

original: iti kāṭhakopaniṣadi prathamā vallī // //
analyzed: iti kāṭhaka upaniṣadi prathamā vallī
translated: Thus ends the first Valli in the Katha Upanishad.

original: ato vihāyānityaiḥ kāmaiḥ pralobhanaṃ yanmayā prārthitaṃ yasmin preta idaṃ vicikitsanaṃ vicikitsanty asti nāstīty evaṃ prakāram /
analyzed: atas vihāya anityaiḥ kāmaiḥ pralobhanam yat mayā prārthitam yasmin prete idam vicikitsanam vicikitsantī asti na asti iti evam prakāram
translated: Therefore, O Death, tell us, what is that great knowledge of the soul, which is the great purpose in the next world, the world hereafter, about which I, being a ghost, have this doubt, this uncertainty as to whether it exists or not?

original: he mṛtyo /
analyzed: he mṛtyo
translated: O Death!

original: sāmparāye paralokaviṣaye mahati mahatprayojananimitta ātmano nirṇayavijñānaṃ yat tad brūhi kathaya no 'smabhyam /
analyzed: sāmparāye para loka viṣaye mahati mahat prayojana nimitte ātmanaḥ nirṇaya vijñānam yat tat brūhi kathaya no smabhyam
translated: Tell us what is that great knowledge of the soul, which is the great purpose in the next world, the world hereafter, about which I, being a ghost, have this doubt, this uncertainty as to whether it exists or not?

original: kiṃ bahunā /
analyzed: kim bahunā
translated: What is the use of much talk?

original: yo 'yaṃ prakṛta ātmaviṣayo varo gūḍhaṃ gahanaṃ durvivecanaṃ prāpto 'nupraviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ yam prakṛtaḥ ātma viṣayaḥ varaḥ gūḍham gahanam durvivecanam prāptaḥ nupraviṣṭaḥ
translated: This boon, which is about the soul, has become hidden, profound, difficult to discern, and has entered into that.

original: tasmād varād anyam avivekibhiḥ prārthanīyam anityaviṣayaṃ varaṃ naciketā na vṛṇīte manasāpīti śruter vacanam iti // // / / //
analyzed: tasmāt varāt anyam avivekibhiḥ prārthanīyam anitya viṣayam varam naciketāḥ na vṛṇīte manasā api iti śruteḥ vacanam iti
translated: Therefore, Naciketas, who does not choose even mentally any other boon, which is impermanent, to be desired by those who cannot discern, from that boon, according to the statement of the scripture.

original: iti kaṭhavallyāṃ prathamavallībhāṣyam // //
